docs.lead_paragraph: From our colleagues at The Lede blog:

headline.main: The Wikipedia Battle Over Joe Wilson's Obama Heckling

docs.abstract: Representative Joe Wilson's shout of "You lie!" during President Obama's health care speech Wednesday set off a furious debate on Wikipedia about how to describe the incident.
docs.snippet: Representative Joe Wilson's shout of "You lie!" during President Obama's health care speech Wednesday set off a furious debate on Wikipedia about how to describe the incident.

docs.lead_paragraph: The typical American household made less money last year than the typical household made a full decade ago.

headline.main: A Decade With No Income Gains

docs.abstract: Median household income was lower last year than in 1998.
docs.snippet: Median household income was lower last year than in 1998.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today the Census Bureau released its annual report on income, poverty and health insurance.

headline.main: Poverty Rate Rises; Uninsured Rate Stays Flat

docs.abstract: Data released today on income, poverty and health insurance coverage by the Census Bureau.
docs.snippet: Data released today on income, poverty and health insurance coverage by the Census Bureau.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reactions to President Obama's speech last night.

headline.main: What He Said, What They Heard

docs.abstract: Reactions to the president's speech on health care.
docs.snippet: Reactions to the president's speech on health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his speech last night, President Obama noted that the country's health care problems aren't limited to the uninsured. People with health insurance can lose their benefits if they lose their jobs. Others who become ill discover that their insurance company has dropped them or won't pay for their care.

headline.main: Tell Us About Your Insurance Battles

docs.abstract: During his speech last night, President Obama noted that the country's health care problems aren't limited to the uninsured. People with health insurance lose health benefits if they lose their jobs. Others who become ill discover their insurance company has dropped them or won't pay for their care.

docs.lead_paragraph: If journalism is the first draft of history, what is a Wikipedia entry when it is updated within minutes of an event to reflect changes in a person's biography?

headline.main: Wikipedia's Rapid Reaction to Outburst During Obama Speech

docs.abstract: If journalism is the first draft of history, what is a Wikipedia entry when it is updated within minutes of an event to reflect changes in a person's biography?

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, Sept. 10, 3:20 p.m. | Mark McClellan, former administrator of Medicare in the Bush administration, says a bipartisan solution is still possible.

headline.main: What Was Missing in Obama's Speech

docs.abstract: Robert Reich and others weigh in on the weaknesses and strengths of the health care address.
docs.snippet: Robert Reich and others weigh in on the weaknesses and strengths of the health care address.

docs.lead_paragraph: The outburst by Representative Joe Wilson, Republican of South Carolina, who shouted "You lie!" during President Obama's health care speech, has focused more attention on the question of what the proposed legislation would or would not do for illegal immigrants.

headline.main: Illegal Immigrants and the Health Care Legislation

docs.abstract: Under currently proposed legislation, illegal immigrants would not qualify for government subsidies but would not be barred from purchasing insurance through health care exchanges.
docs.snippet: Under currently proposed legislation, illegal immigrants would not qualify for government subsidies but would not be barred from purchasing insurance through health care exchanges.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama's address to a joint session of Congress Wednesday night will dominate the conversation in Washington and around the nation today as lawmakers, lobbyists and other politicos assess the implications of his comments.
docs.abstract: The day after President Obama's health care speech to Congress, the subject still dominates the political scene, along with repercussions from a heckling Republican member's breach of protocol.
docs.snippet: The day after President Obama's health care speech to Congress, the subject still dominates the political scene, along with repercussions from a heckling Republican member's breach of protocol.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama's speech to Congress marked a clear turning-point in the health care debate, and Democrats in Congress will now try to capitalize on the momentum.

headline.main: Speech Marks Turning Point in Debate

docs.abstract: Mr. Obama maneuvered deftly to re-take control of the discourse after a rowdy August of town-hall protests and at times wild accusations.
docs.snippet: Mr. Obama maneuvered deftly to re-take control of the discourse after a rowdy August of town-hall protests and at times wild accusations.
